page.title: 17The Railway Walk, Wombourne
page.content: In 1966 the Worcester to Wolverhampton main railway line was closed. The land was owned by the railway but has since been bought by local councils,the rails have been lifted and the derelict line converted into a pleasant walk. The five and a half mile stretch between Castlecroft, to the north of Wombourne, and Wall Heath, to the south of Himley is known as the Railway Walk. The Wombourne Station building has been restored and now provides a permanent exhibition of earlier days as well as what the area now offers. Part of the Walk can be used by horse riders where barriers separate the horses from pedestrians. Most of the time the Walk is used by families out for a pleasant walk in the countryside. In the early morning the joggers take over. Some are out for a fun run but others train here for marathons.
